title: Motorways in Montenegro
text:
<a href="Montenegro">Montenegro</a> is one of the last countries in Europe that does not have any <a href="motorway">motorway</a>s. This situation will change in the foreseeable future, since on 11 May 2015 the construction of motorways has already begun. It is to connect the Montenegrin town and harbor of <a href="Bar%2C%20Montenegro">Bar</a> at the <a href="Adriatic%20Sea">Adriatic Sea</a> with <a href="Serbia">Serbia</a> through the border crossing at <a href="Boljare%2C%20Sjenica">Boljare</a>. From there, a Serbian portion of the motorway should continue towards <a href="Belgrade">Belgrade</a> (a part labeled as A2 motorway is already under construction), which will create a continuous motorway connection between Central Europe and the Montenegrin coast.
On Montenegrin motorways, the planned speed-limit may be of .
Beograd–Bar Motorway.
The <a href="Belgrade%E2%80%93Bar%20motorway">Belgrade–Bar motorway</a>, also known in <a href="Serbian%20language">Serbian</a> and <a href="Montenegrin%20language">Montenegrin</a> as Аутопут Београд–Бар ("Autoput Beograd–Bar") will measure and be part of the <a href="European%20route%20E763">European route E763</a> (E763). Construction has already begun in Serbia as the A2 motorway with a length of , as well as in Montenegro (Smokovac–Mateševo). The whole motorway in Montenegro from Bar to the border with Serbia in Boljare will be . It is a challenging project, which has been divided into five component parts ("dionica"). It will have a total of 42 tunnels and 92 bridges. The construction is financed by <a href="public%E2%80%93private%20partnership">public–private partnership</a> projects; the contractor is the Chinese company CRBC. The motorway have a planned cost in excess of €809.6 million. Probably, the motorway will be subjected to a toll payment like in other countries of the former Yugoslavia. For the part currently in construction - - the toll should amount to €3.28.
Adriatic–Ionian Motorway.
The planned <a href="Adriatic%E2%80%93Ionian%20motorway">Adriatic–Ionian motorway</a> at around 100 km (95.2 km) long should link both Montenegro with <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> in the west and in the east its capital Podgorica with <a href="Albania">Albania</a>. From there it may continue through Albania and further reach <a href="Greece">Greece</a>. A part of the Podgorica's bypass, around in length, may be <a href="concurrency%20%28road%29">shared</a> with the Bar–Boljare motorway.
